# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

```julia
function wrap_string(text, text_width::Int=10)
    lines = String[]
    word_index = 1

    for char in text
        push!(lines, lines[end] * "\n" if length(lines[end]) + 1 > text_width end)

        # Add the character to the current line
        if isword(char)
            while word_index < length(text) && !isword(text[word_index]))
                word_index += 1
            end
            push!(lines, String(word_index), char))
            word_index += 1
        end
    end

    return join(lines, "\n"))
end

# Example usage
text = "Hello, world! This is a long sentence that needs to be wrapped properly."
wrapped_text = wrap_string(text)
println(wrapped_text)
```

This function `wrap_string` takes a text and an optional `text_width` as inputs. It iterates over each character in the text and wraps it onto a new line when the maximum `text_width` is reached.

The example usage demonstrates how to call the function with a sample text, and displays the wrapped text.
